Yes, I can relate to this. It's like your brain gets caught in loops and can't turn away from automatic thoughts. I have been working on this with my psychologist as part of treatment because negative self-talk is a huge problem for me.

He told me that when your executive functions are working as they should, they help filter out automatic thoughts and you have more ability to focus on something other than unproductive lines of thinking. That's why medication helps. And like you, when my medication is working, my negative self-talk is so, so much better. It's not always perfect, but it helps.

That's the physical and medication side of this. Another part of my treatment is Cognitive Behavioral Therapy. This deals with automatic thoughts by attacking them head on and evaluating them objectively. It's more complicated than this, but I am just starting here and recommend you look into this, as well. CBT is mentioned often with ADHD treatment. 

So these two lines of attack are helping for me, bit by bit.

To others with ADHD it is easier to spot I think. Ok well, it was easy for me to spot once I'd read up on it and got diagnosed. 

Most people don't even know what it is so all they are going to do is see the specific flaws manifest. And some even friends will be surprised to hear your diagnosis.

So your boss will notice shit work ethic and missing deadlines and making mistakes. Various people will either find you a little odd or spacey or think you're dumb because of an obvious mistake, or maybe smart when you come up with something brilliant out of left field. Friends will notice other things like forgetting dates. 

Just be the best you possible. I try to understand the symptoms and how it plays out and try to come up with ways to struggle along shielding others and myself from it as best I can. 

Maybe some others judge you harshly but you don't have to join them. You have a lot of good points too.

How old are you? We can't offer medical advice on here,  but if you are still in school there are services you can get to help you use the vision you have most effectively and plan for the future.
